sa-uTf7mqqPFK39vGDBwDg.text: Small joint, Minimal decor. I did like how the sushi bar was set up. Food was def a strong 4.6 but unfortunately the service was poor. We asked for plates but never received them so I ended up eating in a mini soy sauce dipping saucer THE WHOLE TIME. The 2nd round that we ordered was a 35 minute wait for them to tell us they lost our order after they came to check on us twice and said they were making our food. The waiters/waitress' def need to be trained more. They were friendly but, their knowledge on their items need some improving and customer service skills as well. They were having a grand opening special for AYCE & Drink specials until friday. BUT THEY WON'T HAVE ALCOHOL UNTIL NEXT WEEK?!? I guess there won't be any drink specials #sadlife. I will say, we did damage. 11$ AYCE sushi for 2 hours. I will def be coming back for the yummy food. Hopefully next time, they will have more staff.

wOes19rxVr3vmgC9DjlIyQ.text: Gorilla Sushi has a very good atmosphere. The food was great with a variation of sushi options from raw to cooked. The service they provided was excellent the servers helped recommend several cooked rolls. I will definitely return for the AYCE!!

4Bl4jo5q0UKb-RWOG5eoMQ.text: This is my "go to AYCE". I went here after a friend recommended it to me. Customer service is great, we got greeted when we stepped in. Plenty of variety of sushi. What more can I say other than I will be returning for plenty of visits in the near future.

4hgIFm36ODP2iskYIUy3Xw.text: Every time the wifey and I dine here, I always forget to take pics of my beautiful, aesthetically pleasing high quality nigiri sushi lol.  This place definitely deserves my 5 stars because every time we go here the same two servers know who we are and we've been here so much we actually had the opportunity to obtain a FREE ayce sushi dine in after the 10th stamp (they stamped twice every time her & I dined in for ayce).  The service is 5/5, the same Hispanic gentleman and the same Korean gentleman both remember us each time we come in and their service is always friendly and very VERY attentive.  Their nigiri is the perfect fish-to-rice ratio meaning the slices of fish are pretty large, and the rice portion is very small. *Exactly how I like my nigiri sushi.    All the orders always come in so quick! The place is very clean and pretty bright.  And you get surprised upon walking in when every employee greets you loudly in what appears to be in Japanese (don't quote me on that).  We both love this spot, and we will continue to go since it's not much far from where we live.  Thank you guys as always Gorilla Sushi!

gtGiBIOTDCmxDPN_izZR9w.text: A must for me everytime I am in Vegas. The AYCE deal is very unrestrictive and the service is great. They also have great drink specials. Rolls and sushi are always delicious and fresh. Ambiance is loud and lively. They close late, 2 am, so you can always catch a late night crave. The fact that it's off the strip makes the prices reasonable and the service quick and friendly. Def the best sushi spot in town!

JYWOWw2CUHIUscjTs_plzA.text: SERVICE: Sally was our server. She was great. She was very attentive and very patient with us. My friends and I are piggies, so we kept on ordering a ton of food. Food also came out pretty quickly. Overall, service was quite excellent.   FOOD: I've had AYCE sushi all over the valley. Woth that being said, this is one of the best places I've ever eaten at. Where do I start??   Appetizers - we ordered shumai (steamed), fried soft shell crab, corn cheese, baked mussels, takoyaki, shrimp tempura, bulgogu, gorilla hot dog, spicy fried chicken, and pork belly. All of our appetizers tasted very good, except the bulgogi was a bit on the tough side.   Sushi - we had the following nigiri: garlic tuna, yuzu yellowtail, smelt roe, flying fish roe, and sexy salmon. On to the rolls: spicy yellowtail roll, gorilla dream, gorilla special handroll, hawaiian roll, lobster roll, mexican Fiesta roll, and Jay roll.  The fish to rice ratio on the nigiri was phenomenal. You get a huge piece of fish and a small ball of rice. The garlic tuna and yuzu yellowtail was out of bounds good!! All of the rolls tasted good as well, but the nigiri were the star of the show!!   Dessert - green tea cheese cake and a snowflake. Green tea cheesecake was so good!!   I will definitely be back and highly recommend this place to everyone.

qEZPBv5pIuT4ChF0LuCJiw.text: I have to say I used to LOVE Gorilla Sushi! But now it doesn't feel like the sushi chefs are putting any love or effort into their food! I saw a young kid as a sushi chef which I normally wouldn't mind until my sushi came with retangular cuts of fish! Sushi is supposed to be cut on a bias with tails! What happened to the art in cooking! He was more worried about drinking his beer than serving the food the correct way! I am Very disappointed and discouraged to return in fear my fish will come in chunks again! Which isn't appetizing.

i8uzEMUrjfRlbutKswHgyw.text: One scoop of Ice Cream as desert. Ask for more during your all you can eat dinner Is not allowed. It used to be when you went to a Japanese Restaurant you always gad a great experience. Now most of them are owned by Koreans and the service and food quaity is not the same. It's all about the profit.

U3-E2QUV2pCUWWWlskgPKA.text: I had heard about this place a long time ago and kept passing it by while driving for various ride share jobs ;-). I finally got to try this place on a Sunday Night with my wife just a couple days ago.  With that said here is my only complaint: The benches that you sit on are not padded so not very comfortable. I'm guessing they do this to make sure people stick to the 90 minute dining rule lol.   Now, my praise: J.B. was one of the friendliest  and funniest servers we've ever experienced in a restaurant. He joked around and laughed with us like we were just eating in his house. We ordered "The Boom Boom" and right after the song "Boom Boom" came on and he came over and pointed it out and then just laughed about it! LOL  The names on some of the sushi dishes had me cracking up! Viagra, Who's Your Daddy, Who's Your Ex-Wife, Taste Like My Ex-Girlfriend and on and on. SO MANY TO CHOOSE FROM!!!! The ones we had were so awesome! The sauce that they put on many of the dishes was making me melt in my not so comfortable seat. I don't know what kind of sauce it was but it was brown and drizzled on a lot of different dishes. I had The Baked Gorilla, Surf & Turf (Highly recommend), Who's Your Ex-Wife (Deep fried spicy tuna, spicy crab mix in a jalapeno w/spicy mayo & eel sauce) OHHHHH EMMMMMM GEEEEEEE!!!!!!! SOOOOOOOO FRICKEN GOOD!!!! I think it was that eel sauce that I couldn't get enough of! If you like spicy you have to get the "Who's Your Ex Wife"! but lete it sit for a minute because they bake it and it comes to your table HOT as in temperature hot, not just spicy hot.  This isn't a fancy spot but they have very nice and friendly servers and the food is good. K-Pop is playing on the TV and the place is clean! If you love sushi you HAVE to try Gorilla Sushi! I'm definitely going back...but not too often. I need to lose some damn weight!

x2H6ENyPTxx2J_UF2udWEA.text: Came here when line at Sakana was too long, and we are blown away by the quality of food here. Fish is very fresh, and they've got sea urchin! Sushi rice is a bit dry (press rolls) but makis are extremely flavorful! Service is great too. You get welcomed and sent off with goodbyes from the whole crew ( can be a bit overwhelming tbh)

f1MVZ9qkws2TXAAFsK5eJw.text: The 2nd worse sushi joint I've ever been to.  If you have a brain, you would avoid this place.  Place advertises all you can eat but they scam you by having the slowest service ever!  There is a time limit on your eating so they can take forever and you will eventually give up waiting around. Sashimi was tough like it has been sitting out...scary.  sushi rolls were WET!!!  SO WET THEY WERE DRIPPING!!!  This is unacceptable.  When we did order other items on menu that seems very good, they would come back in 10 min and say sorry..we are all out of that.  Lol!!!  Pathetic!  So we gave up on sushi so we ordered udon and other noodle dish.  IT NEVER CAME OUT!!!  yes we have up.  Then we decided we have had enough so we asked for the dessert (ice cream bar).   This came with our meal but that took forever too then we really had to ask the server if we could get the ice cream with 15 min.  PLEASE, AVOID THIS PLACE IF YOU'RE SMART.

6KB43eRGLCIadMQF2PzD2g.text: I've been here a couple of times and average at best. I got the bulgogi the first time and I didn't like it at all. It was dry and had no flavor. I thought the rolls were average and the teriyaki chicken not so good. The teriyaki didn't have enough sauce and was bland. I enjoyed the green tea ice cream but I had to go back for it because the server forgot to charge me for it and just omitted it from my order. Unfortunately I won't be back!

oxhyVw7IRBZQyxkbDxbNZg.text: Gorilla sushi is one of the best AYCE's ever! They do a great job acknowledging you by cheering when you walk in and walk out. Also, they are more than just sushi. They have other soups, ramen, seafood, etc. There is so many variety that it takes 2 menus to cover all that they have. Some of the menu items however, are only one time order per person like the oysters, which I highly recommend by the way. If you like a spice and raw oyster combination then it's delicious! I would say just order it anyways but they will charge for leftovers. When ordering the sushi, try to aim for half orders so that you can try a little bit of each rolls that sound interesting. That way you can find the roll that best fits you! The menu even suggests it too! My favorite roll was the Tropicana. It had a great crunch for breakfast, dinner and lunch! Haha. All the desserts are also one time orders so make that one count. Anyways service was top notch!! I have never seen service quite like this, they do a great job being on top of everything! Shout out to JB too he was one of the servers that did a lot for us, but they were all great.

2e0AAFBznK7ajReQMKD5hw.text: I'm new to Vegas, so I've been in search of some " go to" spots. You know a spot you can always "go to" and it'll never fail. So while scrolling on my IG, appears this spot! I had some spare time while out running errands with my lil one and I said "I had to try it!" Walking in, it wasn't busy so I knew I could actually take my time and not be rushed. Carlos, our server was EXCELLENT! There was one thing I had in mind to try, but after I found out the ALL YOU CAN EAT, was literally that, I had to indulge in what I could manage.  Baked Gorilla Roll-5 Caterpillar-5  Taste like my EX girlfriend -5 Spicy Fried Chicken -4 KISS of Fire-5 Carlos was very helpful and friendly and I truly appreciate his exceptional service when it came to my lil one. I definitely will be back at my new "GO TO" sushi spot

ltowpVhfyfaRFNqL8wuvjw.text: So I found this place through several IG posts that were definitely drool worthy, which prompted me to immediately bookmark this establishment and find the time to schedule a visit. New Years Day was the decided day and time so here goes my review:  Food: Probably the biggest and diverse AYCE sushi menu I've ever seen. Not only will you find Japanese food, but also Korean dishes. Since Korean food is definitely in my top 5 of cuisines, I couldn't help but want some of their appetizers. Of the Korean dishes, we ordered the corn cheese and rice cakes wrapped in bacon. We also ordered the baked mussels (which is a must for ayce) and their tomato roll, which for some reason is only offered one time during your visit (this really should be on the ayce menu along with the other specialty rolls). We ordered so many nigiri and rolls (we ordered all together 27+ items!). What was great was that you're also able to order half orders of rolls, which made it easy to try almost everything to our heart's desire. Overall the fish were fresh, the portion of rice in the nigiri was perfect, and we tried interesting and unique rolls. Did you know they have rolls with banana? That was too unique for me so we didn't order any of that. But the fact they offer that is really cool.   Environment/Ambiance: A small joint in a plaza that's easy to miss. It's a small place, but great for small groups and a lot of counter seating. Not much lighting, but that's okay. There's a number of televisions that are either news, movies, or even music videos (a good mix of american pop and k-pop).   Service: On New Years Day there wasn't that many people out. Not sure if everyone was still waking up from the night before. But we were one of the few groups, so we were promptly helped and tended to constantly. One interesting thing is that to order your rounds, there's no paper to mark things down with. A waiter will come and take your order per round so be ready with what you wanted to try in mind. Their menu offers pictures and for the rolls a description. I actually had to write our orders on my phone to keep track. Whenever we finished plates they were quick to clear our table. Sometimes a little too quick. And sometimes the food came out too quick (although I was hungry and this isn't really a complaint).   Tips: Try some rolls you may have not seen before! And take advantage of ordering half orders so you can try everything! Also be prepared to write down your orders.   Will I be back? For sure.

FpdmtXnBXTHx3cX8nlkYbg.text: I've been here about 5 times already in like 2 months. Lol! One of the best places to eat sushi! I came here through a recommendation, and I'll definitely recommend this place to someone else. Great price, good, the atmosphere here is amazing, the staff is extremely friendly, the wait time is never that long. If you're visiting or a Vegas local, this place is a must!

mcjTh1QXYXiQNZw6IriFfg.text: I went with a group of 6, people and the restaurant was incredibly accommodating when our 6 ended up being 7. The staff was incredibly friendly. The rolls were delicious but I did have 1 major complaint; this place is noisy. The music was extremely loud and whenever someone came into the restaurant the staff yelled a greeting, not like I'm used to at many sushi places, but YELLED. It was so loud that I'm not sure I'll go back, despite the food itself being very good and offering great variety, they had a lot of unique rolls here that I would love to eat again but for myself and several others the noise was a source of anxiety.

-KGm5pQAumP0uLYV9diUog.text: I found about about this place through a instagram foodie that I follow so me and my BF decided to go give it a try especially because we were super hungry after our long drive from San Diego and this place does AYCE. We came in around 8:30-9 and didn't have to wait at all.   You step in the door and you're greeted enthusiastically right away by the ENTIRE staff and throughout your meal, the staff is nothing short of friendly and is always there to provide great service. We're given the menu and there's just so much to try! On top of all the sushi, they have ramen, udon, Korean fares, etc all a part of their AYCE (wow, right?!).  Everything was delicious and though the cuts of fish for nigiri and sashimi are small, it's all you can eat so you can always order more (sashimi along with a few other things are limited to one order per person though). I wish I could have tried more, but my stomach can only handle so much food... haha. I recommend ordering half rolls, so you can try more variety! At the end, each person also gets to choose one dessert as a part of the AYCE deal. We also got a bottle of fruit soju for only $10! What a deal! and it was delicious (tasted like juice! Which can be dangerous, haha)  They have multiple TVs on both sides of the restaurant with sports, game streaming, and music videos.   Overall, we loved our experience and definitely want to come back when we're in Vegas again. Highly recommend!!!

YZpxrJK7WH0QQ28nxQvQ-g.text: All you can eat sushi restaurant in urban Las Vegas.  All you can eat is offered for about $20 a person. I went for lunch. The menu included appetizers, sashimi, sushi rolls, and specialty rolls. They do offer half rolls for the specialty rolls which is great so you can try more.  The waitstaff was very attentive and come by every few minutes to see if you want more food. The sushi was fresh and delicious. I definitely got my money's worth. I will be back!

tZU8GLUzi9US158fO0Qs8A.text: Unfortunately, my time at Gorilla Sushi was quite poor. I enjoyed what food I got, but the amount of time we waited, and the fact they ran out of: Salmon, Kalbi, Uni, Sweet Shrimp, Tempura Ice Cream, Salmon Collar, and Unagi were simply unacceptable even in a soft opening situation. We spent 3.5 hours here, the first full hour of which no sushi dishes came out. The staff was apologetic and I didn't really feel any need to blame them, but there aren't enough sushi chefs and they don't apparently work particularly fast. Another problem is that there are only 3 working during a full dinner evening. They have a lengthy sushi bar, and the fact that they have to take sushi orders from patrons at the bar while falling dramatically behind is flawed.  We made 4 orders on the night. None of them were ever completely filled. The 2nd order came out almost fully before the 1st, and the 1st basically never got filled at all, except for a couple of the rolls. We tried to reorder most of it in the 3rd but by then all the salmon was gone. That meant the three orders of salmon sashimi, five orders of salmon, and three salmon hand rolls *that we had ordered at 7:15pm* never came out. This is probably 9pm by now. And soon after that, they had run out of another 3 common items. We were never informed that they didn't have uni, but I don't think they ever had that, nor the sweet shrimp.  Still, the staff made an effort to apologize and their hands were clearly tied since they simply had run out of stuff. But to run out of Salmon and Unagi at a sushi restaurant? Pretty bad supply management.  As for things that were good - the sushi rice has a decent flavor. The fish quality was adequate to good for an AYCE. While nothing to rave about, their cooked dishes were okay to good. In fact, cooked dishes and ice cream were extremely prompt in delivery. Just not the sushi. And considering the relatively attentive service, I settled on two stars rather than one.  I'm sure they'll iron out the details but I'm not sure we found anything unique or enticing enough to return. The promo they are running during the first week does make it so you'll always get value out of the promo, but not if you include the time invested.

zYTEX_JofHafWneC5e5UkQ.text: I love it!!! That says a lot. The service was great. The place looks fabulous.  #sushi #Yummers #foodie #bulgogi #udon #gyoza #kalbi #yakitori #nigiri #unagi  #full #uni #sofull  all were delish. I especially love the kalbi and salmon sashimi. xdWzkA-fmQkgua9WnXGoTA.text: One of the best all you can eat sushi places in Vegas for sure no question. They have a pretty expansive menu with tons of rolls and a lot of variety in appetizers. Love the Mexican fiesta roll. They have beer and sake specials often and have pretty great desserts. Great value, great sushi.

7whRnM3cqYzD7ekJ9itnrg.text: Let me start by saying that I was really excited to come to this place due to the half off promotion they were having for their opening week.   My group arrived at 5pm expecting some kind of wait only to be greeted with a sign that said "reopening at 630pm" which forced us to find something else to do for another hour and a half which we didn't mind because we understood that the might have needed some time to replenish for the next crowd.  My group of 8 were the first to be seated at 630pm, all starving and ready to eat AYCE sushi. The waitress immediately served us drinks and grabbed our first order. Seemed like a good start!   The first round came out after 30 mins consisting of 3 rolls and about 15 orders of appetizers. 10 mins after demolishing that, we ordered again, then another 42 mins for the second order. So far still good considering how many people were there.   AND THEN ... close to an hour later, the waitress comes back and says that our third and fourth orders were coming. 20 mins after that, still nothing. I think they completely forgot about our orders! To my friends annoyance,  he asked her again if the food was even coming and when she came back after checking on it and said "almost". He just asked for the check so my group can leave. The only time someone would come to our table was to give us more water and more napkins (which we didn't need because we weren't eating anything).   We were in there a total of 3+ hours and I don't think I even ate a whole roll of sushi because we were all sharing the ones that came to our table. Despite their cheap prices, they were clearly understaffed for this promotion and their service was slow. It almost seemed like they didn't expect to be busy. I definitely would have been more understanding if the staff were ALL busy but I saw some hanging around this podium and just waiting for people to make eye contact with them. No sense of urgency for a place that was so busy.   As for the food, order the Starbux roll. That was the only one I liked because that was the only one I got to taste.

pB0O3KCbe9C4TaEubx0FaQ.text: I give this place a solid 3.5 stars. I've eaten at plenty of AYCE sushi places and this one was just okay for me. The inside was very stylish and clean. Their color scheme was black and light colored wood. There was plenty of seating, mostly booths which I liked and a nice little bar you can sit at. Service was great! Everything came out to us pretty fast and we were getting checked up on every now and then. They were not hoovering over us and they weren't ignoring us either.   The sushi was good. We like getting a lot of the cooked rolls to be honest, they were good rolls, but they were somewhat drenched in the eel sauce. Don't get me wrong, eel sauce is good.. but I don't like my rolls swimming in it :( The appetizer selection was huge, I liked the different variations of cucumber salads they had. I also enjoy having a sushi menu that has symbols for spicy sushi rolls and symbols for raw sushi. It makes picking out food so much easier! I might be back here again, depending if I am around that side of town! This place is worth trying out though! :)

Na4nzGQrGhMx6R3oNvZXmQ.text: Reviewing after a 2nd visit.   Take aways from the first visit in Sept. 2016 included good service and bad sushi. Unexpectedly returned in April 2017 and was pleasantly surprised with great sushi as a result of a new head chef.   Great service, fair pricing, and now, great food. Located in an old area, but inside a clean environment.   Seafood is fresh and tasted of great quality. Enjoyed the sashimi, nigiri, hot foods, salads and appetizers much! Salmon, tuna, oysters, yellow-tail, halibut, salmon roe, Cajun albacore, mackerel, eel, sweet shrimp, kalbi, pork belly, tempura, Cucumber salad, sea urchin to name some of my orders that I thoroughly enjoyed.   Additionally offered is Korean comfort foods available for late night take out until 2am. Great selection that I look forward to experiencing.   Recommended to anyone who may have had a poor experience once before, like me. Give it another shot. Also recommended to anyone who enjoys AYCE sushi or desires Korean comfort food for late night pick up.

S8zhz_EDXg9JadwxsEXOJw.text: I come here with my best friend all the time, since the place has opened. It quickly became our favorite sushi places. We decided we wanted to get something to eat and we were both craving sushi so we came to Gorilla. We were seated at our table and we noticed we waited an exceptionally longer time to order drinks or appetizers than usual. We kind of got a little irritated, as the restaurant wasn't as busy as any other time, but no biggie. What really caught our eye though is how much the busser/server girl continued staring us down. We knew that she was just looking to see if we had any extra plates in our way that she can take, but over the course of our meal, what would have been considered excellent service just became super uncomfortable. This girl kept her eyes locked on us at almost ALL times. She walked around our table and stared down at us and at our food. My friend and I both whispered to each other that we felt like we were being judged. We were both sharing AYCE, so it wasn't like we were being watched to make sure one of us who was have AYCE was sharing with someone who was eating a la carte. I mean this girl stared us down even when we had no chance of having any plates taken away. She went up and down the aisle an circles our table like a hawk. Just. Staring. What was most unsettling is the fact that she would stop at the side of our table and just stand there, staring down at us for no damn reason. This went on for an hour. My friend and I both agreed we lost our appetite. I finally got tired of it and we had a tiny plate in between us so it would be easier for me to put the sushi on it to share, and the girl came over to take it and I said "Can I keep this actually?" And the girl looked at me wide eyed, then gave me a nasty look with her hands up in the air, and backed up without saying anything, then walked away. Idk what I did to deserve that, I asked nicely despite how angry I was getting. I used to really like the service but I don't know what happened. I don't know if there's new management telling the busser/servers to do that, if so it's very creepy and really can ruin people's appetites. I hate to say I don't know if we'll be back.....

iTjmJe-iVLvzaGyAEd1mDA.text: Yikes! This place is not for people like me.  I'm a big fan of Nigiri Sushi, and what most people don't know is that sushi is the art of eating rice.  The fish is just the condiment. The rice is called the Shari and the fish is the Neta.  Fish needs to be cross grain so the texture is correct. This place cuts their fish at random.  I got a double order of lengthwise tuna and was very hard to chew.  Which sounds ridiculous because Tuna should melt.  They do not put any wasabi between the Shari and Neta like traditional Edo method, but then again, most places don't.    The wife and I came here as opposed to our usual spot of sushi king because they had an interesting menu of 1time order items.  The surf and turf were not great, cheap steak and baby shrimp. The chicken wings were awful and dry and battered. The calamari tempura was like a greasy onion ring. The Smoked salmon Nigiri was an actual piece of nova scotia lox. LOL WTF?  You're not supposed to use a literal piece of supermarket lox. The Bossam was microwaved when the pork should be served, room temp. The amaebi was not real, just dry basic shrimp butterflied.  Real amaebi should be gooey.  Plus you only get one piece per order even though their menu photos shows two. Doesn't matter, it tasted bad anyways. The sashimi salad you can tell was pre-made and refrigerated because it was slightly frozen.   The rolls were not as great as the rice had too much pressure applied to the rice looked pasty.  It tasted like sushi bought at Smith's I am certain, not much time is spent on their sushi rice.  So I cannot recommend their rolls nor nigiri.  The plus side, they have a great atmosphere and great drink deals, Buy one get one beer and sakes, etc.  However, I'm not much of a drinker anymore in my 40's and neither is my wife so it's not for us.  It's still a fun place to go with friends and get loud. The service is decent,  but if you're strictly here as a foodie like myself.  There are better sushi joints.

ggH1JdYj2w6amB-nSwdNLg.text: Gorilla sushi did not let me down. I wasn't expecting such great service and quality from an all-you-can-eat (AYCE) sushi place.  At gorilla once you order the food it starts coming out. They were so on top of it. I usually order and wait 5-10 minutes between the orders to get everything. Here it was almost instantly! Another great thing about Gorilla is that the server got about 95% of our order correct, meaning they only missed about 2 orders total! That's such good accuracy seeing how our party was a party of 8.  As for the sushi we loved it. For the price you pay you get pretty decent quality. Their sashimi was surprisingly fresh. Being in the middle of the desert, I didn't expect much. I got some good fish. It definitely wasn't the best but pretty good for AYCE. Their rolls tasted great and not cheap at all. Their nigiri has a perfect ratio. There wasn't an excess amount of rice compared to fish. The rice however didn't taste like sushi rice. I think they might have forgotten to put rice wine vinegar with it but it was okay.

M27kyifbRcHyGeziG13Euw.text: Pretty decent nigiri sushi and sushi rolls, especially if you get the all-you-can-eat option and time everything diligently. When I stopped by recently at the beginning of the day, there was a 1-hour time limit on the AYCE, which wasn't a problem as I ordered about 3 items at a time and put in my requests for the next round while I ate.  As for the nigiri sushi, standard items like the salmon, red snapper, eel, smelt roe, and "yum yum scallop" were fairly fresh and tasty. They came in somewhat petite portions, which might be cause for concern on an a la carte basis, but I didn't mind since I was doing the AYCE.  There's also a huge roster of goopy, calorific "special" rolls, baked rolls, and fried rolls to choose from. If you're somewhat diet-conscious (not likely if you're doing the AYCE), or if you're just pacing yourself, you can try many of these in half-rolls. Some are whimsically named, like the "I Love My A**" roll and the "Tastes Like My Ex-Girlfriend" roll, and all were quite satisfying as I'd skipped breakfast before coming here.  If you haven't already stuffed yourself full of fish, rice, and sauces, there's also a good selection of hot and cold apps that you can choose from for the AYCE. The ikayaki, pork belly, and tonkatsu with rice helped fill me up. As place is owned by Korean-Americans (in particular, the hostess appeared to be an owner or manager and was incredibly lively and sweet), you'll also see items like japchae, Korean spicy rice cake, and bulgogi on the menu.  What's more, they have booze specials too. I enjoyed the soju cocktails, which were such a deliciously fruity way to imbibe my booze, and went down well with everything I was eating. All in all, a great find thanks to all you Yelpers out there!

u_7MvSaVfgm5rQQ7gemB2w.text: We normally eat in Sakana Sushi every week. We just wanted to try something new. Based on the reviews, we picked this joint and our expectation were very high.   Food was mediocre at best but Im not the kind of person who leave out negative review for foods since I have great respect for chef, especially Sushi Chef. But if I were to choose, I would not choose this place at any way if you ever been to Yama or Sakana Sushi before and have such expectations. For instance, I ordered three random baked sushi and all of them were almost identical with 50% imitation crab and 30% rice.   What upset me most was our server. The server, J.B, was so funny, we forgot to laugh! He either must be very disrespectful in nature or no sense of mannerism, or both. Thanks for making us uncomfortable tonight. I am glad not many servers are funnier like you. I sincerely wish you best of luck in life.

mVAJPM3TQwiWq7B-dosnpg.text: Weird restaurant name but good reviews on Yelp, sounds like a place worth trying.  First of all, the restaurant has a fresh interior which is very clean and spacious.  This is a contrast to the neighborhood which is a bit on the sketchy side (Eastside of Las Vegas).  We made it out alive, so it's not that bad.  For $26, it's a few dollars more than it's AYCE peers.  Is it worth it?  There is nothing to complain about the sushi, a good rice to fish ratio, precise cuts and fish is of decent quality.  The sashimi is limited to one serving per person and it's worth it, it's a much higher grade than anticipated.  Service is pretty good, with consistent check ins to make sure we placed our orders.  The honey toast was a downer, it's just a sweet bread roll that is slightly toasted with some honey and a scoop of ice cream.  Stick with the ice cream instead  The verdict, I would say it's worth just on the sashimi itself.

aC6UVEJgYh77Ocv0rjdmcA.text: Stumbled across this on yelp and decided to give it a shot. I'm a very big fan of sushi and sometimes I get bored of my same haunts. I was surprised I had never heard of this location, even though I literally lived a mile down the road for 2 years. The good thing is that the place has an amazing ambiance. Slightly dimmed lights gave it that quiet hangout feel which is awesome. I loved the multiple tv's tuned to different stations. 1 was the knight's playoff game, 1 was an E-league match, 1 was baseball, and 1 was a youtube playlist which coincidentally was their source of overhead music. The exact same 4 screens(in backwards order haha) on the opposite wall so everyone can catch whatever no matter where they sit. I love that. The table was clean, and food was tasty. If it had ended there, this place would have been perfect. The 1 fault I had was that there were 5, yes 5 wait staff who work the entire floor. Meaning every. single. 15. seconds. we were hit up with the regular, everything ok? doing alright? everything good? anything else? more drink? Anywhere else with less intensity it would have been a really great thing, but it actually ruined the meal. Pretty much every single bite or sip someone popped up to interrupt us. Dinner conversation? Not likely..... I really REALLY wanna give them the benefit of the doubt and just say ok, the place was mostly empty, which it was, they were a tad over staffed for the hour we were there, everyone was bored and trying to make themselves useful. I really want that to be the case, because they were all super polite and helpful with any questions we had, seriously much love to JD and the rest of them, but my mother was seriously annoyed and I can never bring her back here. I would definitely recommend this place, as I know for a fact it's the best sushi place in it's zip code. Nowhere within 4-5 miles that's as good quality and as comfortable as this place. But for family sushi night? I must resign myself elsewhere.

9uUABwQ1JCHgTMstmrabgQ.text: Must go to if you visiting vegas and love sushi.  Gotta try it.  Great deal. 20 bucks and unlimited sushi.  Connie is the host or owner but she's great btw.  Easy in and out.

ZOREshiC3MZNLN68AevdxA.text: Really great all you can eat sushi.  Other than not being able to make your hand rolls, (you can only order what they hv on the menu) it was an overall great experience. The sushi was delicious, very creative and well made. The service was outstanding and the place was clean,  the only reason I struggle with going back is the music is WAY too loud. It's extremely annoying. They probably do it on purpose to get you out of there, so you don't linger too long. Would've been a 5 star review otherwise.

XgMKRBDjRaAazpuk2y3rbA.text: This place is just incredible specially our sever Sharon!!!  Best costumer service.  Stop by and ask for her.

6WhGRFgxpTPdv9FqKxC51Q.text: Gorilla Sushi really does live up to all of its 5-star Yelp reviews! There's not much else I can add other than the superbly made (in amount and substance) sushi rice here. Other AYCE sushi places I've tried seem to use rice that tastes thick and sticky so it overfills you too quickly, even when there appears to be minimal rice on the roll. Also, the servers are extremely attentive to refill water, bring your food, and remove empty plates. The non-sushi items are all delicious and worth trying too. There's a 90 minute time limit (more than enough time for me) and half rolls are allowed. I think Gorilla Sushi is one of the best AYCE sushi for value and quality on the East side of Vegas, so don't be afraid to drive to this older side of the city if you want to experience some exceptional sushi and service!

MV9MzletgJbZx_uvkYdJQw.text: Wanted to have some sushi buffet, and after looking at a lot of menus from other places, I decided on this one. We came with a party of 6, so we wanted variety for everybody's taste.   There are many special items that can only be ordered once, but they're pretty good portions. The uni came with 2 pieces per order. Nice and creamy. The shrimp came with 2 pieces, the fried head was sooo fresh and good. The sushi was perfect one bite.   We tried many different rolls, they were all created with heart. The only downside is the rolls takes a long time to come. The sushi in general took a long time. They need more sushi chefs. We got most of our order, and was told we still have like 6 rolls left. Kinda sucks because you want to eat the roll when you're most hungry to enjoy the taste.   The sashimi allowed per person was great, I couldn't find another place that offered sashimi except here. They were cut really thinly. And we asked for a couple with no sauce to taste the freshness. It was great!   The rock and roll was good, rice less and refreshing.  Sashimi nachos was good, crispy with nice cold sashimi and sauce.   Was really full near the end but still got some ice cream and mochi in the tummy.  The party was really impressed since this is their first Japanese buffet in Las Vegas. The server was nice and friendly. Had to keep coming around so we could order again. Waters were topped up.

Ordered: I LOVE MY ASS, popcorn lobster, catepillar, kbbq, bonsai, crunch roll, unagi nigiri, Cajun albacore nigiri, house salad, garlic edemame, bulgogi nachos, fried calamari, shumai and to finish off green tea fried ice cream and Affogato.  Menu full of options, but lacked variety. Rolls seem to blend with one another and felt like the same base rolls with different toppings. We were the only ones in there for awhile before a second group showed up. To be fair, EDC was in town so I won't judge and server said it was busy earlier. I did open my pallet to crab so there's that.   Servers Jay and Leo were on top of their game and really made the difference between 3 and 4 stars.   AYCE $24.95 dinner. HALF ORDERS available for 8pc chef specials. Plenty of appetizers in small portions.

I'm assuming this is because of the quick turn around that they have since its not a very large location. _myQGSi8SiPgM183-jl_tA.text: My friend Neli T loves to find great restaurants I haven't been to- it can be a challenge, but she's good at it. I'd driven by here several times and hadn't taken notice, but she invited me for an early dinner and we were both pretty impressed!  Location is clean, service from Austin was super friendly, but more importantly, the fish was hella fresh! The apps alone were worth it for me, with ample starter portions of one-limit items like sashimi salad rather than a couple of tablespoons in a tiny bowl. They also offer a couple of dinner-only sashimi options. The poke and salad were solid, but the seafood nachos and stuffed tomato (crab + avocado wrapped in tuna) were better. Their version of the classic riceless Rock N Roll was better than almost any other version I've tried. I did not partake but their dessert menu is larger than other AYCE options, which is a plus.  I will be coming back- apps and rolls are extensive, but they stand out with their fresh and thick cuts of fish.

MUGPq9GooNDcijpXOrJYcA.text: I definitely give this restaurant a sold 3.5 stars. Sushi or Japanese, in general, is probably one of my most favorite things to eat. I have eaten in a lot of AYCE sushi restaurants and I believe that Gorilla Sushi is good but is still lacking.  Food: The sushi was good in terms of flavor but I would sometimes get sushi that was dry and not cold enough. Don't get me wrong but isn't fresh, raw fish supposed to cold? Yes, it is. The sushi that I got was warm. Consistency is definitely the key. Other than that, there are a lot of different sushi to choose from and some of them are really good such as the Red Snapper and the dragon roll.   Service: The service was really good. The servers were really nice and catered to our needs well. I didn't even have to ask for a refill once when I needed one. They are all very kind.  Overall, I left this restaurant with a good impression but not a great one. I understand that they are still new and have a lot of improvements to be made. It was still worth a try and I would definitely come back if I'm in the area and need a sushi fix fast.

They also offer a few rolls without rice (I really enjoyed the Rock & Roll), as well as some sashimi, which is rare for all-you-can-eat sushi joints. Everything we've tried has been delicious. When the waiter came by I said hey can I get rice for my son for his chicken katsu and he said yes---the rice came instantly but no katsu. It took over an hour for it to come and when it came it had rice with it. I told the waiter, well he didn't touch this bowl of rice waiting, I told you I wanted a bowl of rice to go with the katsu...and you didn't say it came with. And he said oh yeah it comes with. Well ok. Thanks for mentioning that when I asked for it to go with it and thanks for putting it on my bill.  Service lacks for the place being completely empty. Most rolls were good but I can find other places that are better.

photos.caption: Photo of Gorilla Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I asked for rice with my sons katsu-he didn&#39;t say it already came with it and brought me a bowl he didn&#39;t touch and charged me for it.

vpSh8XR_qXljd12jx8KSyw.text: Gorilla sushi is a great spot for groups. Fresh fish and delicious rolls. They play great music and the restaurant has great service. Check out Gorilla sushi next time you want your sushi fix!

photos.caption: Photo of Gorilla Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi

I9fFxijH1VgqIPVO5BX-5A.text: We've been to other sushi places, but this is one of my favorites. They have really fresh sushi, they have pretty fast service and the waiters are very attentive.   We came in about 6 pm. When we first came in it didn't take long for them to seat us. About half the tables were full so they weren't too busy. We ordered drinks first, then ordered some appetizers. My favorite appetizer is the takoyaki. My aunty liked the oysters and said they tasted very fresh. Both aunties also liked the calamari. They didn't like that the calamari were rings because when they bit into it the calamari would separate from the outer batter. Aunty thinks if the calamari were cut into strips it would've been better. They also like the taste of the batter.    Anyways, we also liked that they had a couple of sushi rolls that didn't have rice in them (the Rock N Roll & Johnny). They look similar to regular rolls, the difference is that they're wrapped in thinly sliced cucumber instead of nori and they have no rice in them. We enjoyed these and thought they were very refreshing and light.   Hubby liked the uni. It has a nice golden color so you know it's pretty fresh. I tried it, but it's not for me. I like the ikura better. The uni is one of those items that you can only get one per person and it comes as a pair of nigiri. The ikura doesn't have a limit so yay for me!   They have funny names for the sushi rolls like most places do now a days. The Tastes like my Ex-gf is one of those. It's funny because when my hubby ordered it, the waiter, Ian, covered my ears and asked him "How does she taste?"  Too funny... That roll was very good and most of the others were delicious too. I liked the ones with scallop on top. I know we tried one with what I believe was baked salmon on the top, but that one wasn't as good.   They also have a small assortment of desserts to choose from. You can only choose one per person, but you'd prob only have enough room at the end for one anyway. lol. This time I tried the honey toast. It looks like those little Hawaiian sweet bread rolls toasted with a little scoop of vanilla ice cream on top and honey drizzled all over. Hubby got the affogato. He liked it but it had a stronger coffee flavor than what we're used to from other places.   The price for dinner was about $26 per person for AYCE. There are some plates that you can only get one per person for the whole meal, but if you have a few people in your party then it doesn't really matter much. The waiters are usually pretty entertaining and friendly. Hubby says it's a place worth standing in line for (although I haven't had to stand in line to wait yet).

Photo of Gorilla Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gorilla Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GBcdd76lxRIu_Bhl6SckfQ.text: Service here is so amazing. When you first walked in you get a welcome greeting. They are A1 and on top of their game. It is an AYCE Place which has a variety of options to choose from both back and front menu. My favorite sushi I think it was called Tropicana. The servers are phenomenal and have such a sense of humor. They were always there to refill waters real quick and take any dishes away. You do have a time limit I believe it's an hour but that's more than enough time. Food was great and they had raw oysters (one time only). I definitely will be coming back whenever I'm in town. Keep up the great service. S/o to the server JB you were very helpful and awesome!

E85im_nPLGZ7fc8ydVdelA.text: I have an Instagram account where I post all my travel and food adventures and a few LV people I follow had posted some yummy looking food from Gorilla Sushi. Sushi + Ramen with a Korean twist? Sure, why not! So, we decided to check it out this weekend.  Pros - Nigiri is good...the rice to fish ratio is perfect - There is ramen - More appetizer choices  Cons - Everything is geared towards the sweet side - They use the bad pieces when you order poke and the seafood salad  Service - Service was great. They always had someone taking away the finish plates, refilling your water and even asking if you needed more ginger or wasabi.  Inside - They play very loud music. it's probably the first sushi place I've been to that doesn't play Kpop lol. I don't really care for the type of music they play but hey, I'm here to eat, not to listen. There are open booths throughout. Booths big enough to sit like 8-10 people if you're tiny I guess....lol  Overall Impression The pros/cons is what stood out to us. My bf had a sugar crash right afterwards and I started getting a semi migraine so that is not good. I still want to go back to try their dinner since there are a lot of other options available for dinner only.   I'm not going to say it's the best sushi ever because it's not. Sushi Neko and Hanabi still tops my list.

Tvln8cyVr8Vv6hPvyxHJ3g.text: I stopped by here last night for a takeout.   As I entered the place, it looked very modern, well -lit, with American music turned up high in a good way. Gorilla Sushi has several large TVs playing sports, music videos and other things.   The atmosphere is lively and clean.  I had no trouble finding parking. There is plenty of parking around the restaurant, which is located in a plaza and is next to 7-Eleven.   They do have Ayce sushi for dinner for $26. I ordered Korean food-  Kalbi, Bulgogi and Pork Belly and they were tasty. I wasn't in the mood for sushi then. I wish I had ordered some sushi. I def. want to try the Rock N Roll & Johnny which are wrapped in cucumber instead of rice.  The staff were friendly and when I left tips they all cheered.

U0sZH_OsMYqYMnmJMMnu1A.text: Good food. Horrible service. They asked me 5 times if I wanted to sit at the bar in an empty restaurant?!?!!  If I say table just say ok!!!   Plus took Forever to get anything.... there were 5 other tables. It shouldn't take an 30 min to get my first order.

bFkRab4HFez1PAbR7E3ejA.text: Food great. Waiter great. Flirting happened. Boyfriend jealous ahah.  Our server JB was super friendly and even joked around with us. He definitely made the experience more enjoyable and even recommended what soju drinks to get. All the other servers were equally just as friendly and even joked with us when they brought out the rolls. (You'll understand when you see the sushi roll names)  Loved the names of the sushi rolls and can't really complain about any of the dishes we got. All the fish, raw or cooked, definitely tasted fresh and scrumptious. Portions might be a bit smaller, but definitely don't underestimate how much you order, it'll definitely fill you since a lot of their dishes have rice and their non rice dishes are usually one time orders. And their ACYE isn't just limited to the sushi rolls, nirigi, or sashimi. They also have Korean food and ramen too!   If I lived closer to here or even came back to Vegas, I'd definitely come here again for dinner. (Some of the ACYE dishes are dinner only specials).

photos.caption: Photo of Gorilla Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1 time order of oysters and tuna, yellow tail, and salmon sashimi (ayce)

6_6Ug51tKbDnvkl_wfwdjA.text: Thursday, my husband and I found ourselves in desperate need of a date night.  After going to a movie, he asked me if I wanted to go to dinner, which of course, I said yes.   We pulled up to Gorilla Sushi, and he reminded me that some friends had been raving about this place a while back.    Gorilla Sushi is a bit more on the modern side than other sushi joints we've been to.  Gorilla has several large TVs playing music videos, sports, and other things.  It is open, bright, and well lit.    We were seated right away, and of course, we chose the AYCE option.   I was excited to see that they include some sashimi with AYCE.  It was limited, but I'm totally ok with that.  I'm going to try to recap everything that we ordered:  Sashimi: 3 pieces (each) salmon 3 pieces (each) tuna 3 pieces (each) yellowtail Absolutely wonderful.  The texture and flavor of the fish was phenomenal.  Appetizers: Seaweed salad:  standard.  Delicious Gyoza:  SO. GOOD.  Very different from other gyoza dishes we've had before, this was absolutely incredible.  Garlic Edamame:  Wonderful.  Not greasy, which is always a plus. Screaming Orgasm salad:  One of my favorites of the night.  Delicious.   Nigiri: Let me just say that every single thing we ordered was absolutely delicious.  I might add an additional comment for the ones that were huge standouts, but every single item we ordered was incredible.  We had multiple orders of anything we could get multiple orders of.  (I think the amebi was the only thing we could only get one order of, which was fine.)  Super White: Best in Vegas.  Hands down. Unagi Ebi Amebi:  Absolute perfection. Salmon Smoked Salmon:  OMG.   Garlic Salmon: AMAZING Garlic Tuna Cajun Albacore Halibut Mackerel (not my fav, but better than other spots I've tried) Tako Flying Fish eggs Yuzu Yellowtail  Dessert: Honey Toast:  super cute and small, this was perfect.    Can I talk about the service?  Incredible.  Everyone we interacted with was polite, and very personable.  We received a punch card, too, which is always a plus.  I honestly could not be happier to have found Gorilla...our previous favorite spot has had a slip in quality, so we  are definitely going to make this our new sushi home!!  Thanks to all the staff, and we will see you soon!!!

bH0UnUJ0IyNw03WoA-Ujig.text: The dishes here were disgusting. The food did not at all live up to the Instagram hype. The service made it even worse. Our initial server Sharon had something dropped off to my table that I did not order then got upset and said, "OMG" when I told her that is not what I ordered and had the nerve to tell me she repeated it 3x in which she did not! I've been waiting to come to this place for months and I'm just really saddened by my experience. Our next server tried to make it better and I appreciate it but it was downhill from the first waitress.   Luckily we ended up ordering the Surf n Turf roll which tasted ok. But this was by far the worst service and food experience I've had thus far.

IIpZ4N3OWUdHNrKVAQUKcw.text: One of the best sushi spots I've been to! I've been here twice now and had a great experience on both occasions. Service is stellar! As soon as you walk in, the host/hostess immediately walks up to you and leads you to your table, then a waiter/waitress comes to ask what drink you'd like, and after you order both drinks/food...food starts coming! I love how fast, friendly, and awesome their service is. Also, when they see empty plates on the table, they pick them up almost immediately. They are very attentive and I love that...they refill water without having to flag them down.   Now let's talk about food. I'm all about nigiris! But this place has me eating more than my usual. Nigiris- rice to fish ratio is perfect! Not like most sushi spots, Gorilla give less rice. Their poki salad is delicious! It has a bit of kick to it which I love. Oyster-fresh! Vegetable tempura-mmm so good! Even my 16 month old loved it! I can go on and on but I'd suggest you head on over there to know what I'm talking about! If it's not the food, the service will wow you.

6M2D2EB7YmUvLpbt8tX1ZQ.text: OK I am just going to come out and say it....I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! It is ayce sushi for dinner for 26 dollars. ehXJDnD0UAIPfJpz_boGCg.text: Gorilla sushi... Wow... If you love sushi as much as I do, I highly recommend this place when around Las Vegas. There is plenty of parking around the restaurant, which is located in a plaza next to 7-Eleven. The atmosphere is interesting... The interior was decorated with bright colors and reminded me of a typical sushi restaurant. They played Latin music which was fine but a little confusing for a place that specializes in sushi. We had a party of 6 and got seated immediately on a Saturday night (crazy right). It wasn't that busy and our server was really friendly.  Food: The fish was fresh and tasted like any AYCE (all you can eat) sushi place. One thing I liked about this place is that you can order sashimi! Although it's only one order per person, the cuts were quality. The nigiri was pretty good. I recommend the cajun albacore, salmon, unagi, and yellow tail. The salmon skin hand roll was also really tasty.   DO NOT GET THE KOREAN FOOD!!!! We tried the Bossam, Jap Chae, and Dokkbukki... It was all gross and I highly don't recommend it. Stick with the sushi! Trust me!  However, the shrimp tempura was really good! I recommend that as well.  Service: Our server was really nice; Although, I think he mixed up some of orders and gave us more than we asked, which was unsettling. He came by very often to ask if we wanted more food, but when it came to finishing up our check, he was pushy and asked if we were done a couple of times.  4/5  Pros: -Good quality of fish (for AYCE) -Fast and friendly servers -Spacious restaurant -Accommodates big parties -SASHIMI FOR AYCE  Cons: -18% gratuity automatically applied for parties of 6 or more -Gross Korean Food

Lrcxr0M_WbrY9xRUL8of4Q.text: This place is consistently great from the food to the service. They offer AYCE for dinner at $25.95 per person. Every thing I've had has been delicious from start to finish. My husbands favorite is the garlic tuna. It's fresh and flavorful and it's a staple when we visit. I like the Hawaiian roll. We like to mix it up and sample a variety of different rolls by ordering half rolls so we can try more. Our server tonight was Heidi and she was very friendly and attentive. We ended dinner with green tea mochi and vanilla creme brulee.

ZlflIYIEHBXz42ECTj71xA.text: I've now eaten at Gorilla Sushi 4 times, and have had an excellent experience each time.  I've had the lunch AYCE, the 3-item lunch special twice (as it is near my work location) and now the dinner AYCE.  For both AYCE meals the sushi was very fresh and tasty. the rolls were well packed and professional looking.  They have a very wide selection of items on their menu, which is easy to figure out. I don't think you could try everything without going there at least 10 or so times. My favorite items: for rolls - the MGM (the crispy carrots on top are awesome), the Mexican Beach (really refreshing) and the tastes like your ex-girlfriend (probably does not taste like anyone's ex-girlfriend, but has yummy scallops and warm fried goodness inside)  for nigiri - the mackerel and the garlic tuna.  Mackerel is what I judge most sushi restaurants by...either they get it right or they don't (and they get it right here). My son loves the tacoyaki.    For the lunch special, I have had the dragon roll, sashimi salad, and the garlic chicken, and then the second time I had the rainbow roll, sashimi salad, and ramen.  The rolls and sashimi salad were excellent, and the garlic chicken was good (probably not as good as Fukumimi, but good). The only think I had that was not really good was the ramen.  I would just skip that next time and  probably try the vegetable tempura.  The service is excellent, and I have been seated right away each time.  They have enough seating, which is a big plus when you are on your lunch hour.  For both lunch visits, i was in and out and back to my work about 3/4 mile away easily within my allotted hour. The waiters are very attentive, and the sushi comes out fast.   A dependably excellent experience.

cerI-4IUg_b1FaEEGtg1KA.text: Best sushi place in Vegas ! Such great atmosphere and the servers are all friendly and the sushi is so bomb !!

6KLlmASwsAOMgCvoNbKTQQ.text: Gorilla Sushi is my favorite spots to get sushi in Vegas, the prices are average price but the food is amazing. They have great music playing and the music videos playing at the same time, love the aesthetics. Not to mention all of the staff are super friendly they always greet you when you come in. 0R7K8QAEqHX8H9pt-AkP4w.text: I am SUUUPER disappointed with this spot. Huband and I drove 40 minutes out to this place because i saw the Sushi rolls on IG. I read reviews before we came out and i was super excited. We came here on a Saturday at 3pm, so it wasnt too busy. There was a good amount of staff. We were seated with 2 menus. We let them know we were first timers, so we needed some time. We didnt want to do the AYCE, so the waiter took 1 of the menus, leaving us with  only 1 menu. Where was the thought in that? So of course my husband and i were passing the menu around trying to figure out what we wanted to order.. We finally ordered,got our drinks, the cups and plates were still dirty. They still had food on them, waiters kept taking things off the table  without giving us a heads up. Customer service was just all wack. Overall this place was just blah. Super sad, cause almost everyone else experince was spot on. Mine, on the hand was blah.. we wont be back.

K45i_jaThGmNweFlzkRUMg.text: Don't be fooled by the location, this place has top notch sushi chefs on staff.  We sat at the bar, ordered a la carte and got great service from the chefs and staff.  Salmon and tuna Nigiri was thick cut and fresh. The salmon was especially creamy. The cuts are more short and thick (traditional), vs long but still delicious.  All the rolls we had were delicious! Try the Gorilla Lasagna if you like a richer tasting roll.  For dessert we split a green tea ice cream and got a whole 2 scoops!

We keep ordering the same thing cause they keep forgetting what we ordered like wtf. We got full after a few orders since it took them f****ing forever. This place is not worth 28$ just go somewhere else.

kDxehdbzB_XMfmXCv6OmHQ.text: I came here at noon on a Saturday for AYCE and because they had just opened it wasn't too busy. Looking at the menu, I immediately saw a couple things (half rolls) I wanted to start of with so I put my order in fairly quickly after I got there but I ended up waiting and waiting. My date got two of his rolls, and still mine didn't come out. There was a couple that got there a good 10-15 minutes after I did and they were brought out 4 orders and still nothing of mine had come out. Finally, it must have been nearly 25 mins until I got my half rolls but the server left so fast I couldn't put in more orders which I wanted to do seeing as it was going to take forever. Also, my date had asked for the miso soup as an appetizer and after 3 rolls and still no miso, we had to ask for it again. 3 times we were brought incorrect rolls and once our roll was almost given to the table next to us and it would have been if we hadn't told the server that was ours. Of course we didn't take the incorrect rolls that were brought to us because we assumed they were someone else's and it wouldn't have been right, even if we were hungry and even if ours were taking forever. There was definitely some sort of miscommunication happening between the kitchen and the servers but the servers were still very nice and attentive of re-filling our drinks and aslo very apologetic when something wasn't right so I don't feel like I can knock them. There was a baked roll that I never got but I was already pretty full so no harm done. Other than this though, the food was really good and they have a lot of unique rolls. We ended up being there for over two hours and most of the time we spent waiting. I wasn't in a hurry so although the food took forever, I was a bit annoyed but not too much. If I had somewhere to be afterwards I would've been livid and probably would have asked for a discount. Maybe they were just having a rough start that day. I would still give this place another shot and try some of their other rolls. Hopefully next time will be better though.

ry32HaUwbr4f9Uci_V-wzA.text: This restaurant is beautiful! It's nice to have such a dope sushi place on this side of town. I normally have to drive across town to eat yummy sushi! I prefer plain sashimi =) i also enjoyed having fresh Wasabi too! That made everything awesome.  Honestly, all I eat at ayce places is sashimi [Which is bomb and their nigiri is too!] and ikura with quail egg. If you're a quail egg monster... they do charge $1 per quail egg.. =/ I know alot of my friends love rolls! So I'll definitely bring my friends any family to try this place out!!   And yes, I can't forget the staff.. they're swt and very attentive.. really cool nice people =) I'd come back! And I will!

Whj41QfrTiOr_hV_stkkig.text: I've not yet eaten inside the restaurant, but I've picked up sushi rolls & appetizers to go and I have to say I love the interior; it's so clean and sleek. I'm still sore after losing Min Sok Chon in this location so many years ago, but in all of the incarnations of this business space, the consistent element is friendly, welcoming service. Calling in a pick up order is so quick and easy, and twice when I had questions over menu items, whoever took my order went out of their way to ask the chefs when they weren't 100% sure how to answer my question. That's integrity right there. The menu features lots of over-the-top rolls, but the quality of the fish is not compromised. The prices of basic rolls is obviously a steal; if you are a UNLV student and you don't know about these cheap Cali rolls, you're missing out on life. But I like the Korean dishes that are also available here - don't miss the Scallop Dynomite appetizer, mmmm. One of these days I'll come for the AYCE dinner; they also have a full bar. In the meantime, I love being able to swing in and get great food on the way home at great prices.

dwS-7uFoqh8jQqSnULb9kQ.text: So I'm basing this review on a two day experience.  Day 1: The grand opening we were there when they just opened. Our server was Steven and he seemed like a nice guy but often felt like our table was forgotten. We wanted appetizers first to start and we wanted the Hawaiian Kalbi, the pork belly, Gyoza, and bulgogi with rice. We never got the Kalbi or the pork belly because they were out of it and I'm wondering how because it's day one for them and we were literally one of the first customers. The Gyoza is good and the bulgogi is good. The sushi is decent but there was a weird taste to the crunch rolls. It got busier and what became frustrating is that my table was not getting the service we wanted. What started off as Steven as our server became every server taking our orders getting super confused and then the servers are confused because there's like 4 servers trying to help us and couldn't get our food on time. It was a really long wait to get food. We thought to ourselves not a very good first impression but we will come back when they fixed the kinks.  Day 2: we went yesterday Thursday a day before the final day for 50% off. Just me and my girlfriend this time and we had a table fit for two and we had a guy as our server I don't recall his name but I noticed had like 3 tables two of those tables was me and my girlfriend and another couple sitting next to us. The other table was like a party of 3. Our server was a bit better than last time because he initially took care of us but as the time progressed he forgot about us a lot and I watched him help the other tables back and forth and look at me but would forget to come back and so many times would forget our order and have to remind him three times.   The positive that made me and my girlfriend experience there better was this girl who was working the tables at the other side of the restaurant she was in charge of the tables party of 10, 7, and like 8. She was hustling. Her name is Almira and she walked all the way over to us and asked if we were taken care of and we let her know that we thought but we've been waiting. She decided to help us out even though she had those tables with a huge party when she took our order she got our food in time, she refilled our waters on time which by the way I've been waiting to get refilled if it wasn't for Almira. We got more food and she made sure it got to us. We finally tried the Kalbi and pork belly and it's actually very good. She was a very hard worker and regardless how busy, her customer service stayed on point. We got our desserts on time. The original guy came back and asked if we're okay we told him yes because Almira has been helping us and we really want our check so we can leave now. He said ok be right back and he never came back and we waited 15 more minutes and Almira comes back and asks what we are still doing here because she thought after desserts we would have paid and leave and we told her the situation and she got us our check in not even a minute. So explain that please Gorilla.   Me and my girlfriend were so pleased with how amazing Almiras customer service was and he ability to work under pressure and still be on top of her game. She deserves to be a lead and show everyone else how it's done. The full five stars is respectively for Almira. Thanks from me and my girlfriend for turning our frown upside down.  TIP: ask for Almira next time to serve you, try the Hawaiian Kalbi and pork belly and the sexy salmon nigiri.

xs9WjCnxYr6rp9XL-iprWg.text: I am a big garlic tuna lover so that is usually the first thing I taste when coming into a sushi place as a first timer. I actually like it but beware that they are very generous when it comes to their garlic sauce, which could be a good thing for some and bad for others. I love garlic sauce so it did not phase me at all. Another sushi roll that stood out to me was their bulgogi roll - very good. I have tasted the basic nigiris as well and it tasted pretty fresh. It was only my friend and I in the restaurant so our orders came in quick and our server refilled our waters a lot, and checked up on us consistently. However, we did go into the AYCE mindset where everything is all you can eat including desserts (limiting mochi ice-cream like the other restaurants) and this place only lets you chose ONE dessert item per person. So if you want two scoops of green tea ice-cream, you can't. In our case we wanted to try their fried ice-cream and mochi ice-cream but we could only chose one, other sushi places offer the flexibility to have as much ice-cream scoops and misc. dessert items more than once. That was the only issue for me, I paid $20+ for AYCE when I can't even have the entire package then I might as well go to another restaurant with the same price, and better menu flexibility.

zQYvuyABxI8GHsRWq_vTlQ.text: I'd say more like 3.5 stars. I had high hopes for this place.. Customer service is excellent when my wife and I went for the first time.. Ambiance is good (though location could be better). Now the food.. mostly fresh but BLAND. Oddly-shaped nigiris have way too little rice. I had salmon and yellowtail nigiris = bland. I liked the charred eel nigiri but it was overcooked = dry. Gorilla special handroll was bland. Their uni nigiri was the worst I've had by far. Not fresh and very fishy.... and BLAND! I would say this place is more of a korean-japanese fusion. Their Korean dishes are way tastier than their Japanese food offerings. The sushi chefs were all Koreans (figured). Don't be fooled by the pictures posted in Yelp. Food will come to you in a lot smaller fashion.  Our experience wasn't really bad. Just very very average. Will I go back?Probably not.   Dinner AYCE of $25.95 is standard but you're better off with Sakana (best AYCE sushi by far in my book) or Yama Sushi (the only place with $23.95 AYCE dinner price).

K8XtlmsEM9cK3zmLiyFZtg.text: Waited until my second time to review. 1st time was ok. Figured it must be an off day because how does this spot earn 4.5 stars right?   Today was like wtf? Got sat in a reasonable time. After that was all down hill. Had a certain amount of time to eat before a job across the street at Pinball HOF. Not usually on this side of town other than that. Took what seemed a lifetime just  to order. Literally flagging down anyone who would look our way. Finally decided to get it togo. Cash in book ready to pay for another 6 minutes. Decided to walk to the register to pay. No smiles nor thank yous. Whatevs. Don't mind long waits but I cannot stand for businesses with no passion. The only two things I ordered (two rolls) were missing from my togo. Not enough energy to go back for a refund. And cannot imagine ever going back to figure it out. Don't wish anything bad for local businesses but cannot see this spot lasting the long haul. Sad. Very sad.

QuAkFHooaAxutEcdENMUXw.text: A detour on lunch break choices lead me and a co-worker to this great find. Located in a tight strip mall plaza, I was pleasantly surprised how modern and clean it was inside. We were greeted right away and was seated even though we were planning on getting our food to go.   The dining area was open and spacious. The ceiling had an interesting lighting which brightened up the room quite well. There were 3 chefs at the bar area, which I thought about sitting over there as it was welcoming. Also because it was not the super high table tops I have encountered before at other restaurants. The waitress, Claire, was very friendly and took our orders. Since I couldn't decide, Claire asked me what roll I liked best and I said super white is usually my go to and she recommended the I Love My A** Roll. The menu said it was spicy, but I went for it. Also ordered the Japanese Lasagna, honey toast, spicy ramen, Washington Roll, and Alaska Roll.  Ice cold water was brought out as we waited for our food. The manager, Amy, went above and beyond my expectation. She checked on us as we waited and offered some fried gyoza because she knew we were on lunch and must be hungry! How thoughtful! There is also an AYCE lunch special available, so I will be sure to keep that in mind.  All the food was neatly packaged and I wished I had more time to dine inside, since service was solid. The honey toast was delicious. The Japanese Lasagna was a cream cheese and crab meat delight. The Love Roll was spicy, but I kept eating it anyways. The Washing and Alsaka Roll was mostly salmon based and tasted fresh. Since I didn't have the ramen myself, my coworker said was good, spicy, and had lots of mushrooms in it. I will have to give the ramen try next time. The honey toast was warm had a good honey coating that blended well with the vanilla ice cream. Not a huge portion, but it was enough to satisfy the sweet tooth after a big lunch.  All in all, I am so glad I gave this place a try. The sushi was good, the place is clean and the honey toast was as sweet as their service. Will be coming back soon to try the rest of the menu out.

du7tEkg7Vnpnytfi5NmAWA.text: Whoa oh oh oh. Sally, whew. That girl. Sally "heart" damn yelp don't let us post emojis, but that's what her name tag said, was awesome 5 stars for sure! Just saying. She took care of us from start to finish, as soon as we walked through the door. She was very friendly and did her job very well. I'd be back for sure. Oh I was suppose to review the Gorilla Sushi. Ok fine.   Let's start again. I like Gorilla Sushi. The one thing really going for them is the quality of their seafood. Its excellent. The nigiris have the perfect fish to rice ratio, huge nice cuts of fish and less rice. The garlic tuna, salmon, and hamachi were my favs and would recommend. I believe they offer only an order of sashimi for their AYCE and its only for dinner. I liked the salmon skin salad, screaming orgasm, and white orgasm were all tasty just don't wear a white shirt. They also have a lots of appetizers not just sushi like kalbi, bulgogi, soups, spicy fried chicken. For desserts they're only one order person but they have a good selection like the green tea cheese cake, mochi ice, snowflake which is shaved ice with condensed milk and some flavors chocolate and red bean, affogato, and a few more. The rolls were good couldn't remember them as I ate a lot of different ones. You can order half rolls for a lot of them.  They did forget to make a few items that may or may not have been ordered but no biggy everyone has that problem keeping up with my appetite. Just placed another order then all good. I'd definitely be back though.

I kept waiting and hoping for the OMG moment, but it never came.   My very handsome date and I tried a wide variety of nigiri, sashimi, apps, and rolls.  My favorite was the Caterpillar Roll. The Eel sauce was not too too sweet or overwhelming.  He liked the uni (Sea Urchin) nigiri sushi - which is fine. He can have mine.  We both agreed that the rice was good.  Minor complaint; the music was a bit boisterous and loud for us - but we're a couple of 50-year-old guys who like to converse and gaze adoringly into each other's eyes while we dine. This was a bit more of a college party atmosphere than we tend to enjoy. But that's just us.  With so many great AYCE sushi places in town, Gorilla will either have to get more creative or up the overall food quality for this to be a regular stop for us.

j-xejwdgu5-MA5UOARAXvw.text: Great service, good food!  After living by China Town for years, it's hard finding good AYCE places on this side of town but I'm glad my boyfriend and I found this little hidden gem!  I must say, I love their garlic salmon & garlic tuna nigiri. Actually, just all their nigiris were really good and great portion of fish! We also tried their seared salmon (least favorite), sweet ebi, and white tuna.   I think we overdone it with their appetizers. We tried their oyster, shrimp tempura, fried chicken, shrimp and asparagus skewer and baked green mussel, which by the way I really enjoyed and had way less cheese and cream than most AYCE places.   And the reason why I say we over done it with the rolls is because we could barely finish the actual rolls we ordered. Not really a fan of rolls to begin with, but we decided to try three of them, Boom Boom, Gorilla lasagna and Japanese pizza. The Japanese pizza and gorilla lasagna were pretty much the same flavor, so it was hard to eat both of them.  And to top it off, we ordered Mochi ice cream and Japanese cheesecake for dessert.  Overall, it was probably a 4.5, rounded up of course. The quality of the food was great and the service was also very quick!

hYw4SaE6eZs5dJLMeDDuDw.text: I give gorilla sushi two star for their excellent customer service.  As far as their nigiri rolls and appetizer, they really under deliver. It is an All You Can Eat sushi restaurant but there's no quality in the food they serve whatsoever. I ordered tempura shrimp, soft shell crab and fried rice to start as appetizer. The fried rice was not edible because it was WAY WAY TOO SALTY. I didn't think I ordered a block of salt. Soft shell crab was fried and too oily for my taste.   Take this as a cautionary tale. Read their menu thoroughly including the 7 rules they listed on the menu. My mistake was to not catch this before coming in as first visitor. I was ready to walk out of the restaurant when the waitress told me that I will be charged a la carte if I didn't finish my rice (part of nigiri). They serve nigiri with decent size rice underneath but the rice was mushy and again way too salty.  There's also extra charge for left overs. If I didn't speak up about how awful my dining experience has been here with my waiter might have walked out with a bill bigger than the size of purse.   Beware! I won't consider their fish 'fresh'. I definitely won't be going back.

upTus0_P-TNrMUGUyY_y8w.text: After an exhausting weekend, my friends and I were super stoked to eat some AYCE sushi! We got there right when they opened for lunch. They have a VARIETY of rolls to choose from, including some with interestingly funny names! Three of us got the lunch special ($20.95) whereas my sister chose dinner (25.95). We realized there were some options only for dinner and that's why she chose that one. What's really awesome about this place is that they have korean food and ramen on their menu as well. All their sushi rolls were delicious and they really don't skimp out on the fish/meats. The rice to fish ratio was pretty good, not too much rice like some places. The only downfall I have is that the special options that comes with the dinner price can only be ordered once and you can not waste any food (including rice!!) All in all, really good spot if you're looking to indulge in a huge amount of sushi! I will definitely go back!

-Ho5rnHFRwHgVZ_Pop_xyg.text: This place is awesome. All you can eat lunch is very affordable. When we went, it was pretty empty which was nice. The Empire State roll is by far the best! abWPf3vNDXYDfWltVLNJ-w.text: This place is still my favorite sushi spot on the East Side of Las Vegas.  The Boom Boom roll is always a go to, there are so many great options, and the nigiri is consistently amazing!  The staff is great, and the chefs will always delight your taste buds with their creations.   Have you ever been to a place so often that it becomes a regular thing, and you start overlooking it?  It had been a few weeks since I had gone back to Gorilla, and I had tried a few other places.  Suddenly I found myself drawn to come back.  As the song goes, it feels like the first time...  Some places wow with a huge assortment of rolls which have nothing different except for order of ingredients, or sauces.  Not Gorilla.  Gorilla has many different rolls that are not just swapping sauces, but creatively topped, and well thought out.  Their Nigiri is always one of my favorite options, I love their Cajun Albacore.   There are many options, but none have the great food, staff, and atmosphere of Gorilla.  Especially late at night, this is definitely a great hang out spot.    As Ahnold said in the Terminator- I'll be back.
